data.prerequisites: Experience as a journalist, producer, or presenter in any field of media work. University degree in media.
data.courseDescription: To be a successful media professional or journalist, it is not enough to be only proficient in your media tools, but also to have a perfect language free of grammatical errors. This can only be achieved by developing your language in parallel with understanding the grammar.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Identify the basics of Arabic sentence structure and its attachments. Avoid most grammatical errors in media. Discuss the functional meanings of punctuation marks.
data.courseOutline: Concept of language and the structure of the Arabic sentence: Value of proper writing in media work. Components of Arabic sentence. Sentence attachments. Philosophy of grammar. Media writing errors and how to overcome them: Reasons and justifications for writing errors. Most common mistakes in journalistic writing. Overcoming mistakes. The difference between linguistic error and opinion. Media editing and punctuation marks: Editorial policy. Journalistic writing and grammar. Functional meaning. Semantic values.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: Five years of work experience for holders of media degree. Seven years of work experience non-media degree holders.
data.courseDescription: Media content is the primary product of the media industry, and it is the tool responsible for achieving the purpose of establishing the media institution and its strategic objectives towards the audience. This is the reason for which financial budgets are set and expenditures are made.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Define concept of media institution's identity and strategic planning of media content. Analyze governing principles and production foundations for media content planning. Identify the stages of media content planning and prepare the strategic plan. Distinguish between types of problems that media institutions face.
data.courseOutline: Basic introduction on media and planning: Types of media organizations and media content. Functions of media and the principles of media work. Concept of strategic planning for media content and its importance. Outcomes resulting from strategic planning for media content. Governing principles for media content planning: Overall media objectives. Functions. Audience. Production basics of media content planning: Subject scope. Geographic scope. Technical templates. Production unit and production location. Phases of media content strategic planning: Define the production principles. Distribute weekly broadcast sessions on the production principles. Distribute task to production units. Prepare the general framework for production units and the objectives matrix. Planning of the production units. Planning of episodes and preparing the weekly broadcast schedule. Chalenges in strategic planning for media content: Intellectual problems. Administrative problems. Financial problems.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: University degree. Some experience in conference and events’ organization.
data.courseDescription: You can reach the greatest ideas, but you'll need someone to help you turn these ideas into results, as we can't reach the summit unless we team up.” Walt Disney. This quote confirms that organized teamwork is the only way to have a successful conference or event. In fact, such events are like a music composition which requires talented musicians, good instruments and most importantly a skilled maestro who can lead the orchestra with love, understanding, good organization and clear role assignment so that the lyric won’t be dissonant. This course will put its participants at the beginning of the path to creating and organizing a successful conference or event creatively and professionally.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Choose a suitable event concept and define its objectives and elements. Apply skills in designing event programs and effectively managing partners. Manage the financial and media aspects of the event professionally. Handle crowds at large events and evaluate the results of the event.
data.courseOutline: Planning and organizing events: Choose the event idea and define its objectives. Build the initial perception of the event and choosing the title. Determine the time and location of the event. Build a visual identity for the event. Event organization and execution: Build the event program and accompanying events. Partners, supporters, sponsors and key guests. Service providers, equipment and facilities. Financial and media management of the event: Form work teams and specialized committees. Event marketing. Financial and media management of the event. Work forms and follow-up schedules. Practical event management: Manage crowds at large events. Manage digital events. Harvest the results of the event. Performance monitoring and evaluation.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: High school diploma or equivalent. Experience in the digital field.
data.courseDescription: In today's digital age, effective online communication is crucial for building a company's brand, engaging with stakeholders, and achieving business objectives. Companies that effectively leverage digital communication are better positioned to thrive in the digital age. In this course, participants will have a strong understanding of digital communication for companies, practical skills in content creation, social media strategy, and measurement of digital success. They will be prepared to develop and implement effective digital communication strategies that align with their company's goals and enhance its online presence.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Define the fundamentals of digital communication for corporates. Create a comprehensive strategy for digital platforms and digital content. Develop a digital communication plan for institutions across digital channels.
data.courseOutline: Introduction to digital communication for companies: Fundamentals of digital communication for business and institutions. The role of digital communication in modern business. The digital landscape: trends and challenges. Social media strategy development: Identify goals for digital platforms. Choose the appropriate digital platforms. Plan digital content tailored to the audience. Design innovative targeted advertising campaigns. Digital content creation: Content creation strategies. Storytelling in the digital age. Content optimization for search engines. Effective digital communication plan: Design a digital communication roadmap. Integration with marketing and communication strategies. Measure the effectiveness of key digital performance indicators.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.courseName: Stress Management in the Workplace ( Online )
data.prerequisites: There are no prerequisites.
data.courseDescription: Many of us experience stress and pressures in life, whether it's short-term stress from one-time projects or long-term stress from a job that constantly causes pressure. This is not only annoying but can seriously affect our health and work. However, it is possible to manage these pressures if you use the right tools and techniques.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: • Define stress and tension and their main causes. • Identify types of stress, their causes, and their consequences. • Explore principles and strategies for controlling and managing stress. • Practice some techniques for stress management.
data.courseOutline: • Introduction to stress concept: Understand the meaning of stress and tension. Causes of stress. Myths about stress. • Types and effects of stress: Types of stress. Psychological and physical symptoms of stress and pressure. Effects of stress and pressure. • Understanding people and oneself: Stress and pressure and the way of thinking. How to reduce stress and pressure when dealing with others. Stress and pressure management within a team. • Strategies for managing stress: Emotional management. Acceptance of oneself and others. Techniques for reducing stress and pressure.
data.courseBenefits: An electronic graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: High school degree or equivalent.
data.courseDescription: Food photography is not an easy thing as we all might think. Composition, lighting, angles, backgrounds, colors, montage and editing are all important in creating an integrated image with food photography.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this workshop, participants will: Prepare effectively before food photography. Use beauty techniques for food photography. Capture food in a more professional manner.
data.courseOutline: Preparing tools and foods: Choose suitable foods and tools for photography. Prepare and arrange food attractively. Composition and lighting: Use the correct composition to arrange components within the frame. Lenses and how to use them effectively. Control lighting and use natural or artificial lighting. Highlighting food's beauty: Select appropriate colors to highlight the food. Choose suitable backgrounds to enhance the image's aesthetics. Avoid excessive effects or modifications.
data.courseBenefits: A participation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: A minimum of 3 years of work experience.
data.courseDescription: Project management is a rapidly evolving global discipline. Companies are now focusing on managing their operations through a project-based approach rather than traditional methods to increase their focus on delivering high-level results within budget constraints and tight deadlines while meeting customer needs.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Differentiate between project management and operations management concepts. Balance the project scope, budget, and scheduled time. Analyze risks based on probability and impact and develop an appropriate response plan.
data.courseOutline: Introduction to project management: General definition of the project management concept. Relationship between the project and the company's overall structure. Differences between a project and operations, the project life cycle. Executing the project scope: Inputs, outputs, tools, and techniques within the project scope. Determine the cost and time required for execution. Risk identification and analysis: Inputs, outputs, tools, and techniques for identifying project risks. Develop an appropriate response plan for each risk. Identifying means of communication within the project. Establish quality control measures within the project.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: High school diploma and above.
data.courseDescription: There is no doubt that each of us has their own story that they want to communicate to the public. The value of these stories increases when they are related to the future of individuals and institutions, and the gains from promoting it. However, many people have important stories that they do not know how present to the public in an influential manner. At the top of these reasons is the fear and tension of facing the public. The biggest problem that they may not have a compelling story, and the most dangerous part is that they may not even realize it. Studies confirm that a few leaders and executives have remarkably relied on their stardom and distinction on their ability to speak to audience, influence them, and then convince them of their ideas and gain new supporters. Whether your speech is formal or informal, whether you hold a position or not, and regardless of the type and number of your audience, in this course, we will help you to make an impact, master the skills of effective communication, discover your independent speaking personality, and explore your potential for stardom.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Identify personal attributes in public speaking. Prepare professional content and mental readiness. Deliver professional performances in front of the public. Differentiate between audience types and how to interact with them.
data.courseOutline: • Basic introductions: Effective public speaking. Foundation of charisma: innate or acquired. Challenges of facing audiences. • Pre-confrontation: Psychological and mental preparation. Deal with tension and stiffness at the initial shock. Prepare professional content. Overcome fear right before the confrontation. • During confrontation: Emotional stability and overcoming the fear of the beginning. Build mutual feeling with the audience. Handle unexpected situations. • Audience types: Attract the audience. Deal with audience questions. Conclusion and leave an impact.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: Desire to learn the art of dubbing and voiceover. Proper pronunciation and reasonable voice quality.
data.courseDescription: Dubbing requires a keen sense, acting abilities, and rhythm because it involves the audio performance that replaces the voices of the characters in the artistic work with a matching acting performance, considering lip movement and word timing. As for voiceover, it is an audio element that is added to the image and is not part of its composition, but it is sometimes necessary and may add a new aesthetic dimension to the image or diminish its importance. This underscores the importance of the art of dubbing and voiceover, both of which have become arts that require special skills and training.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Apply the stages of dubbing process. Practice voiceover methods professionally. Discover the techniques used in the sound studio.
data.courseOutline: Dubbing art: Introduction to acting and actor's tools. Voice tone, pronunciation of alphabets, proper intonation, pauses. Arabic language grammar and how to adhere them. Stages of dubbing process: translation, preparation, voice performance. Voiceover: Overview of film genres: animated, dramatic, documentary. Voiceover techniques and their importance. Technical skills inside the sound studio: Familiarization with the sound studio and its equipment. Software used for recording and recording techniques. Handling the microphone for a clean and flawless recording.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: High school diploma, a university degree is preferred.
data.courseDescription: A television photojournalist is a journalist who conveys news and ideas through both visuals and sound, using video cameras. They are capable of executing various television works, including dramas, documentaries, news programs, and sports coverage, both in-studio and in the field.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: • Identify the fundamentals and concepts of television filming. • Discuss techniques used in television filming. • Enhance quality of photography by applying dramatic and aesthetic concepts. • Differentiate between lighting techniques inside and outside the studio.
data.courseOutline: • Introduction to TV filming: TV work environment and the role of a television photographer. Concept of still photography and motion pictures and their relationship to realism. Concept of visual language. Primary and secondary colors. • Technical concepts in TV filming: Light properties: reflection, refraction, and diffusion. Types of cameras, their components, and their functions. Concept of color temperature and its impact on the image. Choose appropriate lenses and filters. • Dramatic and aesthetic concepts of filming: Camera movements and rules for choosing shooting angles. Lighting, visual elements, and rules of visual composition. Changing focal length and its dramatic effect on the image. Elements that affect the depth of field. • Filming and lighting inside and outside the studio: Concept of indoor and outdoor lighting and the differences between them. Artificial and natural lighting and the differences between them. Filming and lighting interviews with multiple cameras inside the studio. Filming outdoor scenes or interviews with natural lighting.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.prerequisites: University degree in the field of media or human sciences. Basic understanding of journalism or writing skills.
data.courseDescription: A journalistic report is considered an essential part of the field of journalism and is a primary means through which organizations communicate with their audiences. It is a form of written or multimedia content created by journalists to convey information about current events, issues, or developments to the public. Through practical exercises in this course, participants will enhance their report-writing abilities and become proficient in creating engaging and informative news stories.
data.courseObjective: By the end of this course, participants will: Identify the basics of the journalistic report. Distinguish between various types of journalistic reports. Develop skills in creating journalistic reports. Use narrative storytelling techniques in report writing. Write news reports that meet standards.
data.courseOutline: Introduction to journalistic report writing: Overview of journalistic writing and its importance. Identify news elements and angles. Professional considerations in journalistic reporting. Types of journalistic reports: Various types of journalistic reports and how to write them. Organize the essential elements in journalistic reports. Choose the appropriate writing style. Journalistic reports structure: Basics of the report structure. Analyze the structure of the main body of the report and organize information. Write a strong conclusion and summary for the report. Storytelling techniques: Create compelling story headings and hooks. Balance storytelling with information. Use sensory details and descriptive language. Producing high-quality reports: Standards for journalistic reporting. Editing skills to improve text flow and clarity. Critical evaluation and quality improvement.
data.courseBenefits: A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

data.courseDescription: There is no doubt that each of us has their own story that they want to communicate to the public. The value of these stories increases when they are related to the future of individuals and institutions, and the gains from promoting it. However, many people have important stories that they do not know how present to the public in an influential manner. At the top of these reasons is the fear and tension of facing the public. Handle unexpected situations. • Audience types: Attract the audience. Deal with audience questions. Conclusion and leave an impact.
